item.name: CVE-1999-0001
item.desc: ip_input.c in BSD-derived TCP/IP implementations allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash or hang) via crafted packets.

refs.ref: 19981223 Re: CERT Advisory CA-98.13 - TCP/IP Denial of Service

comments.comment:
A Bugtraq posting indicates that the bug has to do with "short packets with certain options set," so the description should be modified accordingly.
But is this the same as CVE-1999-0052? That one is related to nestea (CVE-1999-0257) and probably the one described in BUGTRAQ:19981023 nestea v2 against freebsd 3.0-Release The patch for nestea is in ip_input.c around line 750. The patches for CVE-1999-0001 are in lines 388&446. So, CVE-1999-0001 is different from CVE-1999-0257 and CVE-1999-0052. The FreeBSD patch for CVE-1999-0052 is in line 750. So, CVE-1999-0257 and CVE-1999-0052 may be the same, though CVE-1999-0052 should be RECAST since this bug affects Linux and other OSes besides FreeBSD.
XF:teardrop(338) This assignment was based solely on references to the CERT advisory.

The description for BID:190, which links to CVE-1999-0052 (a FreeBSD advisory), notes that the patches provided by FreeBSD in CERT:CA-1998-13 suggest a connection between CVE-1999-0001 and CVE-1999-0052. CERT:CA-1998-13 is too vague to be sure without further analysis.

item.name: CVE-1999-0002
item.desc: Buffer overflow in NFS mountd gives root access to remote attackers, mostly in Linux systems.

item.name: CVE-1999-0003
item.desc: Execute commands as root via buffer overflow in Tooltalk database server (rpc.ttdbserverd).

item.name: CVE-1999-0004
item.desc: MIME buffer overflow in email clients, e.g. Solaris mailtool and Outlook.

votes.accept: Baker, Cole, Collins, Dik, Landfield, Magdych, Northcutt, Wall

comments.comment: Extremely minor, but I believe e-mail is the correct term. (If you reject this suggestion, I will not be devastated.) :-)

This issue seems to have been rediscovered in BUGTRAQ:20000515 Eudora Pro & Outlook Overflow - too long filenames again http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=95842482413076&w=2
Also see BUGTRAQ:19990320 Eudora Attachment Buffer Overflow http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=92195396912110&w=2
CVE-2000-0415 may be a later rediscovery of this problem for Outlook.
Sun bug 4163471,
ADDREF BID:125
BUGTRAQ:19980730 Long Filenames & Lotus Products URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=90221104526201&w=2

item.name: CVE-1999-0005
item.desc: Arbitrary command execution via IMAP buffer overflow in authenticate command.

item.name: CVE-1999-0006
item.desc: Buffer overflow in POP servers based on BSD/Qualcomm's qpopper allows remote attackers to gain root access using a long PASS command.

item.name: CVE-1999-0007
item.desc: Information from SSL-encrypted sessions via PKCS #1.

item.name: CVE-1999-0008
item.desc: Buffer overflow in NIS+, in Sun's rpc.nisd program.

item.name: CVE-1999-0009
item.desc: Inverse query buffer overflow in BIND 4.9 and BIND 8 Releases.

item.name: CVE-1999-0010
item.desc: Denial of Service vulnerability in BIND 8 Releases via maliciously formatted DNS messages.

item.name: CVE-1999-0011
item.desc: Denial of Service vulnerabilities in BIND 4.9 and BIND 8 Releases via CNAME record and zone transfer.

item.name: CVE-1999-0012
item.desc: Some web servers under Microsoft Windows allow remote attackers to bypass access restrictions for files with long file names.

item.name: CVE-1999-0013
item.desc: Stolen credentials from SSH clients via ssh-agent program, allowing other local users to access remote accounts belonging to the ssh-agent user.

item.name: CVE-1999-0014
item.desc: Unauthorized privileged access or denial of service via dtappgather program in CDE.

item.name: CVE-1999-0015
item.desc: Teardrop IP denial of service.

comments.comment: XF: teardrop-mod
Not sure how many separate "instances" of Teardrop there are. See: CVE-1999-0015, CVE-1999-0104, CVE-1999-0257, CVE-1999-0258
See the SCO advisory at: http://www.securityfocus.com/templates/advisory.html?id=1411 which may further clarify the issue.

MSKB:Q154174 MSKB:Q154174 (CVE-1999-0015) and MSKB:Q179129 (CVE-1999-0104) indicate that CVE-1999-0015 was fixed in NT SP3, but CVE-1999-0104 was not. Thus CD:SF-LOC suggests that the problems keep separate candidates because one problem appears in a different version than the other.

BID:124 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/124 Consider MSKB:Q154174 http://support.microsoft.com/support/kb/articles/q154/1/74.asp Consider BUGTRAQ:19971113 Linux IP fragment overlap bug http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/8014

item.name: CVE-1999-0016
item.desc: Land IP denial of service.

item.name: CVE-1999-0017
item.desc: FTP servers can allow an attacker to connect to arbitrary ports on machines other than the FTP client, aka FTP bounce.

item.name: CVE-1999-0018
item.desc: Buffer overflow in statd allows root privileges.

item.name: CVE-1999-0019
item.desc: Delete or create a file via rpc.statd, due to invalid information.

item.name: CVE-1999-0020
item.desc: ** REJECT ** DO NOT USE THIS CANDIDATE NUMBER. ConsultIDs: CVE-1999-0032. Reason: This candidate is a duplicate of CVE-1999-0032. Notes: All CVE users should reference CVE-1999-0032 instead of this candidate. All references and descriptions in this candidate have been removed to prevent accidental usage.

comments.comment: XF:lpr-bo
DUPE CVE-1999-0032, which includes XF:lpr-bo

item.name: CVE-1999-0021
item.desc: Arbitrary command execution via buffer overflow in Count.cgi (wwwcount) cgi-bin program.

item.name: CVE-1999-0022
item.desc: Local user gains root privileges via buffer overflow in rdist, via expstr() function.

item.name: CVE-1999-0023
item.desc: Local user gains root privileges via buffer overflow in rdist, via lookup() function.

item.name: CVE-1999-0024
item.desc: DNS cache poisoning via BIND, by predictable query IDs.

item.name: CVE-1999-0025
item.desc: root privileges via buffer overflow in df command on SGI IRIX systems.

item.name: CVE-1999-0026
item.desc: root privileges via buffer overflow in pset command on SGI IRIX systems.

item.name: CVE-1999-0027
item.desc: root privileges via buffer overflow in eject command on SGI IRIX systems.

item.name: CVE-1999-0028
item.desc: root privileges via buffer overflow in login/scheme command on SGI IRIX systems.

item.name: CVE-1999-0029
item.desc: root privileges via buffer overflow in ordist command on SGI IRIX systems.

item.name: CVE-1999-0030
item.desc: root privileges via buffer overflow in xlock command on SGI IRIX systems.

comments.comment: XF:xlock-bo (also add) As per xlock-bo, also appears on AIX, BSDI, DG/UX, FreeBSD, Solaris, and several Linii. Also, don't you mean to cite SGI:19970502-02-PX? The one you list is login/scheme.
Notice that this xlock overflow is the same as in CA-97.13. CA-97.21 simply is a reminder.

As pointed out by Elias, CA-97.21 states: "For more information about vulnerabilities in xlock... see CA-97.13" CA-97.13 = CVE-1999-0038. This may also be a duplicate with CVE-1999-0306.
See exploits at:
http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=87602167418394&w=2 http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=87602167418404&w=2
Sun also has this problem, at http://sunsolve.sun.com/pub-cgi/retrieve.pl?doctype=coll&doc=secbull/150&type=0&nav=sec.sba

item.name: CVE-1999-0031
item.desc: JavaScript in Internet Explorer 3.x and 4.x, and Netscape 2.x, 3.x and 4.x, allows remote attackers to monitor a user's web activities, aka the Bell Labs vulnerability.

item.name: CVE-1999-0032
item.desc: Buffer overflow in lpr, as used in BSD-based systems including Linux, allows local users to execute arbitrary code as root via a long -C (classification) command line option.

refs.ref: 19960813 Possible bufferoverflow condition in lpr, xterm and xload
[freebsd-security] 19961025 Vadim Kolontsov: BoS: Linux & BSD's lpr exploit
[linux-security] 19961122 LSF Update#14: Vulnerability of the lpr program.

item.name: CVE-1999-0033
item.desc: Command execution in Sun systems via buffer overflow in the at program.

votes.accept: Baker, Cole, Collins, Dik, Hill, Northcutt, Shostack, Wall

comments.comment: This vulnerability also manifests itself for the following platforms: AIX, HPUX, IRIX, Solaris, SCO, NCR MP-RAS. In this light, please add the following: Reference: XF:at-bo
ADDREF SGI:19971102-01-PX ftp://patches.sgi.com/support/free/security/advisories/19971102-01-PX SCO:SB.97:01 ftp://ftp.sco.com/SSE/security_bulletins/SB.97:01a
CIAC:F-15 http://ciac.llnl.gov/ciac/bulletins/f-15.shtml HP:HPSBUX9502-023
Add period to the end of the description.

item.desc: Buffer overflow in suidperl (sperl), Perl 4.x and 5.x.

item.name: CVE-1999-0035
item.desc: Race condition in signal handling routine in ftpd, allowing read/write arbitrary files.

item.name: CVE-1999-0036
item.desc: IRIX login program with a nonzero LOCKOUT parameter allows creation or damage to files.

item.name: CVE-1999-0037
item.desc: Arbitrary command execution via metamail package using message headers, when user processes attacker's message using metamail.

item.name: CVE-1999-0038
item.desc: Buffer overflow in xlock program allows local users to execute commands as root.

item.name: CVE-1999-0039
item.desc: webdist CGI program (webdist.cgi) in SGI IRIX allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in the distloc parameter.

refs.ref: 19970507 Re: SGI Security Advisory 19970501-01-A - Vulnerability in

item.name: CVE-1999-0040
item.desc: Buffer overflow in Xt library of X Windowing System allows local users to execute commands with root privileges.

item.name: CVE-1999-0041
item.desc: Buffer overflow in NLS (Natural Language Service).

item.name: CVE-1999-0042
item.desc: Buffer overflow in University of Washington's implementation of IMAP and POP servers.

item.name: CVE-1999-0043
item.desc: Command execution via shell metachars in INN daemon (innd) 1.5 using "newgroup" and "rmgroup" control messages, and others.

item.name: CVE-1999-0044
item.desc: fsdump command in IRIX allows local users to obtain root access by modifying sensitive files.

item.name: CVE-1999-0045
item.desc: List of arbitrary files on Web host via nph-test-cgi script.

item.name: CVE-1999-0046
item.desc: Buffer overflow of rlogin program using TERM environmental variable.

item.name: CVE-1999-0047
item.desc: MIME conversion buffer overflow in sendmail versions 8.8.3 and 8.8.4.

item.name: CVE-1999-0048
item.desc: Talkd, when given corrupt DNS information, can be used to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges.

item.name: CVE-1999-0049
item.desc: Csetup under IRIX allows arbitrary file creation or overwriting.

item.name: CVE-1999-0050
item.desc: Buffer overflow in HP-UX newgrp program.

item.name: CVE-1999-0051
item.desc: Arbitrary file creation and program execution using FLEXlm LicenseManager, from versions 4.0 to 5.0, in IRIX.

item.name: CVE-1999-0052
item.desc: IP fragmentation denial of service in FreeBSD allows a remote attacker to cause a crash.

item.name: CVE-1999-0053
item.desc: TCP RST denial of service in FreeBSD.

item.name: CVE-1999-0054
item.desc: Sun's ftpd daemon can be subjected to a denial of service.

item.name: CVE-1999-0055
item.desc: Buffer overflows in Sun libnsl allow root access.

item.name: CVE-1999-0056
item.desc: Buffer overflow in Sun's ping program can give root access to local users.

item.name: CVE-1999-0057
item.desc: Vacation program allows command execution by remote users through a sendmail command.

item.name: CVE-1999-0058
item.desc: Buffer overflow in PHP cgi program, php.cgi allows shell access.

item.name: CVE-1999-0059
item.desc: IRIX fam service allows an attacker to obtain a list of all files on the server.

item.name: CVE-1999-0060
item.desc: Attackers can cause a denial of service in Ascend MAX and Pipeline routers with a malformed packet to the discard port, which is used by the Java Configurator tool.

item.name: CVE-1999-0061
item.desc: File creation and deletion, and remote execution, in the BSD line printer daemon (lpd).

comments.comment:
This should be split into three separate problems based on the SNI advisory. But there's newer information to further complicate things.
What do we do about this one? in 1997 or so, SNI did an advisory on this problem. In early 2000, it was still discovered to be present in some Linux systems. So an SF-DISCOVERY content decision might say that this is a long enough time between the two, so this should be recorded separately. But they're the same codebase... so if we keep them in the same entry, how do we make sure that this entry reflects that some new information has been discovered?
The use of dot notation may help in this regard, to use one dot for the original problem as discovered in 1997, and another dot for the resurgence of the problem in 2000.
We should merge these.

Perhaps this should be NAI-19 instead of NAI-20? The original Bugtraq post for the SNI advisory suggests SNI-19: BUGTRAQ:19971002 SNI-19:BSD lpd vulnerability URL:SNI-19:BSD lpd vulnerability
Also add: BUGTRAQ:19971021 SNI-19: BSD lpd vulnerabilities (UPDATE) URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=87747479514310&w=2
However, archives of "NAI-0020" point to the lpd vuln.
If I recall correctly, some of the NAI advisory numbers got switched when NAI acquired SNI.

item.name: CVE-1999-0062
item.desc: The chpass command in OpenBSD allows a local user to gain root access through file descriptor leakage.

item.name: CVE-1999-0063
item.desc: Cisco IOS 12.0 and other versions can be crashed by malicious UDP packets to the syslog port.

item.name: CVE-1999-0064
item.desc: Buffer overflow in AIX lquerylv program gives root access to local users.

item.name: CVE-1999-0065
item.desc: Multiple buffer overflows in how dtmail handles attachments allows a remote attacker to execute commands.

item.name: CVE-1999-0066
item.desc: AnyForm CGI remote execution.

item.name: CVE-1999-0067
item.desc: phf CGI program allows remote command execution through shell metacharacters.
